column2: This Jihad variant of the Indra was revised & updated for its mission of transporting Battle Armor. Its vehicle Infantry Bay was expanded to 5 tons. The vehicle's original weaponry was completely replaced. It now has a front-mounted Plasma Cannon with 20 rounds. For infantry protection, the vehicle was outfitted with a quad of AP Gauss Rifles mounted on a turret. For protection to the rear, the vehicle was given a single B-Pod. To improve the vehicles sensors, a Light Active Probe was added. Wheeled: Fast in open ground, slow in rough terrain. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. column2: This variant returns the Ku back to its parent design's original mission of infantry fighting vehicle / troops transport. The Fusion Engine is exchanged for an XL model, which opens more room in the vehicle. A 10 ton Infantry Bay is installed in the vehicle's hull. All of the Ku's original weaponry is removed in favor of a pair of turret mounted ER Medium Lasers. For anti-infantry defense, a pair of AP Gauss Rifles are mounted on the vehicle. One is placed in the turret and the other is mounted in the front of the vehicle. Wheeled: Fast in open ground, slow in rough terrain. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. column2: The Challenger X Main Battle Tank was designed to combat the threat the Clans posed to the Inner Sphere. Equipped with a 270 rated XL Engine, the Challenger X has a top speed of 54kph, allowing it to keep pace with formations of heavy units. The tank is protected by fourteen tons of Ferro-Fibrous Armor with an anti-missile system providing additional protection from missiles. The Challenger's primary weaponry includes a turret mounted Gauss Rifle with two tons of ammo. For closer range threats, a LB 10-X Autocannon is also turret-mounted with two tons of ammo. An Artemis IV FCS-enhanced LRM-10 provides additional ranged firepower. To combat threats at short range, the Challenger X has a pair of Streak SRM 2 launchers protecting the sides of the tank, two front-mounted Medium Pulse Lasers and a rear-mounted Small Pulse Laser. Tracked: High traction, agile turning. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 3/5 Hex: 90/150 Meters. column2: The Demolisher II Heavy Tank is an upgrade of the original Demolisher, whose factory on Sudeten was lost to Clan Jade Falcon. The resulting product is a slow-moving tank that can literally demolish anything in its path. CASE protects the crew of this vehicle from potentially-lethal ammunition explosions. Fourteen and a half tons of Ferro-Fibrous armor protect the vehicle from all but the most determined and concentrated of assaults. The Demolisher II carries two large-bore autocannons. An Ultra Autocannon/20 is paired with a LB-X Autocannon/20 allowing it to deal an incredible amount of damage to a concentrated area, or shred exposed internal components. Both of these weapons are mounted in a turret, giving them the largest possible field of fire. Twin front-mounted Machine Guns deter infantry assaults. Tracked: High traction, agile turning. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 3/5 Hex: 90/150 Meters. column2: Introduced in 2952, the Behemoth was designed for increased firepower and heavy armor rather than speed or manoeuvrability. The design allowed the Behemoth to engage both distant and short-range targets, while allowing it to stand up to almost any type of unit possible. The two turret-mounted AC-10s enable the Behemoth to deal out a great deal of damage at a long distance. The four front-mounted LRM-5’s increase this damage potential. For closer targets, two SRM-6 packs are mounted on the turret and the Behemoth boasts two ball turrets, each mounting one SRM-2 and two Machine Guns. The final two SRM-2 packs are mounted in a half-turret on the front of tank. Tracked: High traction, agile turning. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 3/5 Hex: 90/150 Meters. column2: During the Jihad, the Capellan Confederation's forces were savaged by the onslaught of the war. After receiving the call from Capellan Confederation Armed Forces High Command to submit designs to help aid in the rebuilding of the armed forces, Hellespont 'Mech Works of Betelgeuse responded with the HW1 Hwacha. The Hwacha's sole weaponry lies in its three 20-tubed Medium Ranged Missile Launchers located in the turret. With nine gunners, the vehicle's turreted weapons are supplied with six tons of ammunition. The weapons are guided by a modern military Advanced Fire Control system. Wheeled: Fast in open ground, slow in rough terrain. Fuel Cell: Improved vehicle engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 3/5 Hex: 90/150 Meters. column3: During the Jihad, the Capellan Confederation's forces were savaged by the onslaught of the war. After receiving the call from Capellan Confederation Armed Forces High Command to submit designs to help aid in the rebuilding of the armed forces, Hellespont 'Mech Works of Betelgeuse responded with the HW1 Hwacha. The Hwacha's sole weaponry lies in its three 20-tubed Medium Ranged Missile Launchers located in the turret. With nine gunners, the vehicle's turreted weapons are supplied with six tons of ammunition. The weapons are guided by a modern military Advanced Fire Control system. Wheeled: Fast in open ground, slow in rough terrain. Fuel Cell: Improved vehicle engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 3/5 Hex: 90/150 Meters. Armor: Armor Primitive Structure: Primitive Structure Values A S Front 77 25 Left 60 25 Right 60 25 Rear 50 25 Turret 65 25 Total 312 125

column2: The J-37 Ordnance Transport is a support vehicle used for resupplying military units in the field. Based on the earlier J-27 Ordnance Transport, it has been produced in the Capellan Confederation by Ceres Metals since the twenty-eighth century, though production was halted by the Succession Wars. In response to the failings of the J-27, the J-37 is larger, with the ability to carry 17 tons of cargo, and better protected, replacing the vulnerable trailer with an enclosed hold. It also comes with a one-ton Infantry Transport Bay and carries 5.5 tons of combat-grade armor. The vehicle's high speed, powered by a Fusion Engine, allows it to quickly get to its destination and, if necessary, flee from the enemy. Wheeled: Fast in open ground, slow in rough terrain. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 5/8 Hex: 150/240 Meters. column2: The Patton-SB’s weapons are designed to take advantage of the hazards of vacuum combat by spreading out their damage to maximize the chances of a breach. Its Silver Bullet Gauss rifle, combined with a Holly five-tube LRM launcher combine hull breach seeking ordinance and long range firepower in an attractive package; both with plenty of ammunition. Two Diverse Optics lasers serve as the tank’s secondary weapons and deter close assault. column2: Developed by the New Earth Trading Company in 2587, the Alacorn has developed a reputation as an effective and dependable tank. The design is popular with mercenary units and minor powers who can't afford BattleMechs, because of its heavy offensive weaponry and thirteen tons of armor; however, this payload is only possible through the use of an expensive and fragile 285 XL Engine. The three turret-mounted Gauss Rifles allow the Alacorn to unleash devastating barrages at range, with five tons of reloads offering excellent endurance in combat. Tracked: High traction, agile turning. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 3/5 Hex: 90/150 Meters. column2: Produced by Defiance Industries when the Word of Blake held Hesperus II, this version of the SturmFeur was equipped with a Light Fusion Engine. The weapons were removed and replaced by a forward firing LRM-20 with Artemis IV fire control system. A single B-Pod was attached to every side of the hull, protecting the SturmFeur from infantry attacks. The body also housed the Improved C3 Computer common to Word of Blake units. The turret carried a single TAG system, two ER Medium Lasers, and a pair of MML-9s with Artemis IV FCS. The LRM-20 had a ton of ammunition, and the MML-9s had a ton each of SRM and LRM ammunition. Tracked: High traction, agile turning. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 3/5 Hex: 90/150 Meters.
